stem: Select the correct IV fluid based on its tonicity and physiological effect.
template: A(n) {{type1}} solution like 0.45% Normal Saline moves fluid into the cells, whereas a(n) {{type2}} solution like 3% Normal Saline pulls fluid out of the cells into the vascular space.

rationale.correct: Hypotonic (Low solute) = Fluid shifts INTO cells (Cell swells). Hypertonic (High solute) = Fluid shifts OUT of cells (Cell shrinks).
rationale.incorrect: Isotonic solutions (0.9% NS, LR) stay in the vascular space without causing significant cellular shifts.
clinicalPearls: Hypertonic saline is used cautiously for severe hyponatremia or increased ICP.

questionTrap.howToOvercome: D5W is isotonic in the bag but becomes hypotonic in the body as the dextrose is metabolized.
